moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c5 4. cxd5 exd5: The fianachetto bishop combats the isolated pawn directly and exerts major influence on the light squares
moves.7... Be7 8. O-O O-O 9. Bg5: in-directly puts more pressure on the IDP
moves.9... cxd4: a typical sortie that releases tension in the centre
moves.10. Nxd4: Capturing back the pawn and clearing the diagonal for the bishop. White is clearly better here
moves.10... h6: This is not a wise move.
moves.11. Bxf6: Since I was provoked I decided to remove a defender of the d pawn but I give the superb diagonal to black
moves.11... Bxf6 12. Nb3: threatening to capture the d pawn
moves.12... d4: An assertive move but perhaps a bit too aggressive. The pawn looks well supported on this square but it gone too far ahead. The solid 12. Be6 is recommended where black is passive but solid
moves.13. Nd5: ! a great sortie that cuts off one of the defends to the d pawn and threatens to remove another defender. And refutes black's last move in style.
moves.13... Be5 14. Nc5: a bit of aggressive move but this stops black from advancing the d pawn further.
moves.14... Rb8 15. Rc1 Re8 16. Qd2: clearing the back rank and connecting the rooks.
moves.16... Bd6 17. b4 Bg4: if 17. ...Bxc5 then 18. Rxc5 would give white a slight  but enduring edge
moves.18. Rfe1 Bxc5: ? Black needs this bishop so can not afford to give it up so easily
moves.19. Rxc5: White is better but not winning
moves.19... a6 20. Nf4: The knight is a bit awkward here but I want to attack c6
moves.20... Rc8 21. h3: ! a good move that forces black into a cramped position. The bishop has no good retreat squares.
moves.21... Be6: The bishop makes for a better door than a window
moves.22. Rec1: c6 is starting to feel the heat.
moves.22... Bd7: One would wonder if 21. ...Bd7 would have been preferred
moves.23. a4: threatening to break through with b4-b5
moves.23... Qb6: This queen is not going to be happy here.
moves.24. Rc1c4: White has a massive space advantage and black's defense is about to fall like a house of cards
moves.26... gxf6 27. Qxh6: with all of his pieces tied down on the king side the Black king is singing the blues
moves.27... Ne5: Forced Black can not allow white to put a rook on the H-file
moves.28. Rxd4 Qb8: The cause is hopeless for black. the knight is doomed and white will win along the H-file
moves.29. Rxe5: This is a good move because it removes a critical defender of the king.
moves.29... Qxe5: White has mate threats and 3 active pieces for the rook.
moves.30. Rh4 f5: forced or it would be mate on h8
moves.31. Rh5 Re6: again forced or mate on g5
moves.32... Kf8 33. Qxd8+ Be8: only move as Re8 loses the bishop
moves.34. Bxb7: a waiting move that forces black to play his queen off the critical e5 square. I want to play Bd5
moves.34... Qxe2 35. Rxf5: not 35. Kg2 when the queen would be allowed to return to e5
